# Question

You are given a markdown-formatted text `md`. Write a function `q_and_a_extractor` to extract all text in the markdown sections Question and Answer (starting with `# Question` and `# Answer`, respectively) and return the answer in a tuple like `(question,answer)`. Strip any leading spaces and newlines from the extracted text.

```julia
function q_and_a_extractor(md::AbstractString)
    questions = findall(r"^# Question\s+([^\n]+)", md)
    answers = findall(r"^# Answer\s+([^\n]+)", md)
    
    if length(questions) != length(answers)
        throw(ErrorException("The number of questions and answers must be the same."))
    end
    
    q_and_a = [(strip(md[start(questions[i]) + 9:stop(questions[i])]),
                strip(md[start(answers[i]) + 8:stop(answers[i])])) for i in 1:length(questions)]
    return q_and_a
end
```

This function uses regular expressions to find all sections starting with `# Question` and `# Answer` within the provided markdown text. It then strips leading spaces and newlines from the extracted texts and returns a tuple of `(question, answer)` pairs. If the number of questions and answers is not equal, an error is thrown.
